title: US 75 Dallas photos
text: 2015 status: Some of the features shown in these photos were demolished in 2007-2008 as part of the DART Green Line construction.

images.caption: This looks north from the Routh overpass. The southbound lanes were closed for DART light rail construction.

imageStatus.note: The Routh Street overpass was demolished and no longer exists.

images.caption: Debris has been spread across the closed southbound lanes, possibly to block vehicles.
The northbound lanes still have the original concrete. Motorists who drove the original Central Expressway may remember its coarse, rough-textured concrete.
Another view of the original concrete.

This looks north at the Routh overpass. Below, work was in progress on the DART southeast green line light rail. This bridge was removed as part of the light rail project, and the traffic lanes were lowered to ground level with a ground-level crossing of the DART tracks.

imageStatus.note: The Routh Street overpass was demolished and no longer exists.

images.caption: This view looks west from the Central Expressway Routh overpass. Ahead, in the bright light, the guideway for the light rail is visible.
A close-up of the antique guardrail on the northbound side.

imageStatus.note: The Routh Street overpass was demolished and no longer exists.

images.caption: The antique guardrail on the southbound side.

imageStatus.note: The Routh Street overpass was demolished and no longer exists.

images.caption: Looking south from Routh. The signal ahead is currently the start/end of the freeway, but it appears the start/end will be shifted north after the construction. The poles are most likely for light rail overhead wires.

imageStatus.note: The Routh Street overpass was demolished and no longer exists.
